results.title: Beni Abbes: science in the desert
results.brief_description: Beni Abbes is a Scientific Research Centre, set up in the Sahara by the French. This film shows some of he work being done, in an effort to make the desert fertile once more. Test growing of plants, the use of wind to drive pumps which draw water from below the sand, and an experimental station which aims to harness the sun’s heat to produce power are some of the activities shown.

results.title: Beneficient reprobate: ethyl alcohol, its nature and properties
results.creator_credit: Elmer Clifton and Burton Holmes Films
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Women’s Christian Temperance Union, this film deals with the industrial uses of alcohol, and the effects of alcohol on the central nervous system of the human body. Produced from Bertha Rachel Palmer’s “A Syllabus in Alcohol Education”.

results.brief_description: Documentary travelogue view of the south sea islands and their native peoples. Includes Tahiti, New Zealand (South Island), Fiji, Samoan Islands, Papua and Kalabahi.

results.title: Being in: Life Be In It
results.brief_description: Examines the ‘Life Be In It’ campaign, its progress and the continued support it needs form members of the community, and advocates ways of becoming a part of the program. The ‘Life Be In It’ campaign was aimed at fostering community involvement in physical recreation, physical fitness and healthier lifestyles for all Australian.

results.title: Being in touch
results.brief_description: This film considers the topic of baby massage and its contribution to healthy child development. Takes a look at the importance given to baby massage in other cultures: India, Nigeria, Tahiti, as well as the growing recognition of baby massage in Australia. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Being and doing
results.brief_description: In this collaboration between one of Britain’s leading performance artists, Stuart Brisley and a major independent film-maker, records of Performance Art have been extensively manipulated; the images slowed down, fragmented, and details isolated to construct a filmic ‘memory’ of the events.

results.title: Behind the scenes at Walt Disney studios
results.creator_credit: Alfred L Werker, Hamilton Luske and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Humorist Robert Benchley visits the Disney Studios to sell Walt on the idea of animating the story of The Reluctant Dragon. While evading an officious young studio guide, Benchley stumbles into various studio activities and departments, including an art class, a sound effects session, the multiplane camera studio (at which point he notices the film has switched to Technicolor), the paint lab, a storyboard session for the “Baby Weems” segment, a movieola screening of the Goofy cartoon “How to Ride a Horse”, and finally catches up with Walt in a screening room just as he’s previewing the studio’s latest film… The Reluctant Dragon! Cinematography by Bert Glennon and Winton C. Hock. Edited by Paul Weatherwax.

results.title: Beginners please
results.creator_credit: Donald Carter, BFI, Gaumont-British Instructional and Exclusive Films
results.brief_description: All physical training must be begun gently; gymnastics should be started with light excerises. This film demonstrates games designed to ease the muscles before going on to more strenuous and involved movements.

results.title: Before death us do part: a do-it-yourself guide to divorce
results.creator_credit: Tony Wright, Sharon Connolly, Trevor Graham, Film Victoria and Yarra Bank Films
results.brief_description: A humourous but educational approach looking at the process of how to obtain a divorce in Australia. Using the forum of a talk-back radio program, callers with questions about divorce are dealt with by the announcer, Abby Wright, in a clear and informative style. The program is accompanied by a User Guide and can be used as an educational tool in demonstrating the process of obtaining a divorce in Australia.
results.title_for_label: Before death us do part: a do-it-yourself guide to divorce
